message.content:
I'll calculate each financial ratio step by step based on the given financial statements.

## Current Ratio
Current Ratio = Total Current Assets / Total Current Liabilities
Current Ratio = $23,990,150.22 / $4,319,436.82 = 5.55

## Gross Profit Margin
Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Gross Profit Margin = ($4,788,736.33 / $16,388,736.33) × 100% = 29.22%

## Debt to Asset Ratio
Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets
Debt to Asset Ratio = $4,319,436.82 / $33,610,271.98 = 0.13

## Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%
Net Profit Margin = ($1,290,835.16 / $16,388,736.33) × 100% = 7.88%

## Cash to Current Debt Ratio
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits) / Total Current Liabilities
Cash to Current Debt Ratio = ($9,383,594.56 + $2,573,984.92) / $4,319,436.82 = $11,957,579.48 / $4,319,436.82 = 2.77

## Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities - Capital Expenditures (Purchase of Fixed Assets)
FCF = -$6,316,405.44 - $1,726,015.08 = -$8,042,420.52
(Note: This matches the Net Increase in Cash and Cash Equivalents from the Cash Flow statement)

## Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%
ROA = ($1,290,835.16 / $33,610,271.98) × 100% = 3.84%

```json
{"solution": {'Current Ratio': '5.55', 'Gross Profit Margin': '29.22%', 'Debt to Asset Ratio': '0.13', 'Net Profit Margin': '7.88%', 'Cash to Current Debt Ratio': '2.77', 'Free Cash Flow (FCF)': '-8042420.52', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '3.84%'} }
```
